00070 void
00071 ExprStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
00072     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
00073         return;
00074 
00075     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
00076     if (expr) 
00077         expr->GetValue(ctx);
00078 }

00125 /** Utility routine that emits code to initialize a symbol given an
00126     initializer expression.
00127 
00128     @param lvalue    Memory location of storage for the symbol's data
00129     @param symName   Name of symbol (used in error messages)
00130     @param type      Type of variable being initialized
00131     @param initExpr  Expression for the initializer
00132     @param ctx       FunctionEmitContext to use for generating instructions
00133     @param pos       Source file position of the variable being initialized
00134 */
00135 static void
00136 lInitSymbol(llvm::Value *lvalue, const char *symName, const Type *type, 
00137             Expr *initExpr, FunctionEmitContext *ctx, SourcePos pos) {
00138     if (initExpr == NULL) {
00139         // Initialize things without initializers to the undefined value.
00140         // To auto-initialize everything to zero, replace 'UndefValue' with
00141         // 'NullValue' in the below
00142         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ltype = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
00143         ctx->StoreInst(llvm::UndefValue::get(ltype), lvalue);
00144         return;
00145     }
00146 
00147     // If the initializer is a straight up expression that isn't an
00148     // ExprList, then we'll see if we can type convert it to the type of
00149     // the variable.
00150     if (dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(initExpr) == NULL) {
00151         Expr *tcInit = initExpr->TypeConv(type, "inititalizer", true);
00152         if (tcInit != NULL) {
00153             llvm::Value *initializerValue = tcInit->GetValue(ctx);
00154             if (initializerValue != NULL)
00155                 // Bingo; store the value in the variable's storage
00156                 ctx->StoreInst(initializerValue, lvalue);
00157             return;
00158         }
00159     }
00160 
00161     // Atomic types and enums can't be initialized with { ... } initializer
00162     // expressions, so print an error and return if that's what we've got
00163     // here..
00164     if (dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type) != NULL ||
00165         dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL) {
00166         if (dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(initExpr) != NULL)
00167             Error(initExpr->pos, "Expression list initializers can't be used for "
00168                   "variable \"%s\' with type \"%s\".", symName,
00169                   type->GetString().c_str());
00170         return;
00171     }
00172 
00173     const ReferenceType *rt = dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type);
00174     if (rt) {
00175         if (!Type::Equal(initExpr->GetType(), rt)) {
00176             Error(initExpr->pos, "Initializer for reference type \"%s\" must have same "
00177                   "reference type itself. \"%s\" is incompatible.", 
00178                   rt->GetString().c_str(), initExpr->GetType()->GetString().c_str());
00179             return;
00180         }
00181 
00182         llvm::Value *initializerValue = initExpr->GetValue(ctx);
00183         if (initializerValue)
00184             ctx->StoreInst(initializerValue, lvalue);
00185         return;
00186     }
00187 
00188     // There are two cases for initializing structs, arrays and vectors;
00189     // either a single initializer may be provided (float foo[3] = 0;), in
00190     // which case all of the elements are initialized to the given value,
00191     // or an initializer list may be provided (float foo[3] = { 1,2,3 }),
00192     // in which case the elements are initialized with the corresponding
00193     // values.
00194     const CollectionType *collectionType = 
00195         dynamic_cast<const CollectionType *>(type);
00196     if (collectionType != NULL) {
00197         std::string name;
00198         if (dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(type) != NULL)
00199             name = "struct";
00200         else if (dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type) != NULL) 
00201             name = "array";
00202         else if (dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type) != NULL) 
00203             name = "vector";
00204         else 
00205             FATAL("Unexpected CollectionType in lInitSymbol()");
00206 
00207         ExprList *exprList = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(initExpr);
00208         if (exprList != NULL) {
00209             // The { ... } case; make sure we have the same number of
00210             // expressions in the ExprList as we have struct members
00211             int nInits = exprList->exprs.size();
00212             if (nInits != collectionType->GetElementCount()) {
00213                 Error(initExpr->pos, "Initializer for %s \"%s\" requires "
00214                       "%d values; %d provided.", name.c_str(), symName, 
00215                       collectionType->GetElementCount(), nInits);
00216                 return;
00217             }
00218 
00219             // Initialize each element with the corresponding value from
00220             // the ExprList
00221             for (int i = 0; i < nInits; ++i) {
00222                 llvm::Value *ep = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i, "element");
00223                 lInitSymbol(ep, symName, collectionType->GetElementType(i), 
00224                             exprList->exprs[i], ctx, pos);
00225             }
00226         }
00227         else
00228             Error(initExpr->pos, "Can't assign type \"%s\" to \"%s\".",
00229                   initExpr->GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
00230                   collectionType->GetString().c_str());
00231         return;
00232     }
00233 
00234     FATAL("Unexpected Type in lInitSymbol()");
00235 }

00237 
00238 void
00239 DeclStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
00240     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
00241         return;
00242 
00243     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < declaration->declarators.size(); ++i) {
00244         Declarator *decl = declaration->declarators[i];
00245         if (!decl || decl->isFunction) 
00246             continue;
00247 
00248         Symbol *sym = decl->sym;
00249         assert(decl->sym != NULL);
00250         const Type *type = sym->type;
00251         if (!type)
00252             continue;
00253 
00254         // Now that we're in the thick of emitting code, it's easy for us
00255         // to find out the level of nesting of varying control flow we're
00256         // in at this declaration.  So we can finally set that
00257         // Symbol::varyingCFDepth variable.
00258         // @todo It's disgusting to be doing this here.
00259         sym->varyingCFDepth = ctx->VaryingCFDepth();
00260 
00261         ctx->SetDebugPos(sym->pos);
00262 
00263         // If it's an array that was declared without a size but has an
00264         // initializer list, then use the number of elements in the
00265         // initializer list to finally set the array's size.
00266         const ArrayType *at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type);
00267         if (at && at->GetElementCount() == 0) {
00268             ExprList *exprList = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(decl->initExpr);
00269             if (exprList) {
00270                 ArrayType *t = at->GetSizedArray(exprList->exprs.size());
00271                 assert(t != NULL);
00272                 sym->type = type = t;
00273             }
00274             else {
00275                 Error(sym->pos, "Can't declare an unsized array as a local "
00276                       "variable without providing an initializer expression to "
00277                       "set its size.");
00278                 continue;
00279             }
00280         }
00281 
00282         // References must have initializer expressions as well.
00283         if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type) && decl->initExpr == NULL) {
00284             Error(sym->pos,
00285                   "Must provide initializer for reference-type variable \"%s\".",
00286                   sym->name.c_str());
00287             continue;
00288         }
00289 
00290         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *llvmType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
00291         assert(llvmType != NULL);
00292 
00293         if (declaration->declSpecs->storageClass == SC_STATIC) {
00294             // For static variables, we need a compile-time constant value
00295             // for its initializer; if there's no initializer, we use a
00296             // zero value.
00297             llvm::Constant *cinit = NULL;
00298             if (decl->initExpr) {
00299                 cinit = decl->initExpr->GetConstant(type);
00300                 if (!cinit)
00301                     Error(sym->pos, "Initializer for static variable \"%s\" must be a constant.",
00302                           sym->name.c_str());
00303             }
00304             if (!cinit)
00305                 cinit = llvm::Constant::getNullValue(llvmType);
00306 
00307             // Allocate space for the static variable in global scope, so
00308             // that it persists across function calls
00309             sym->storagePtr =
00310                 new llvm::GlobalVariable(*m->module, llvmType, type->IsConstType(),
00311                                          llvm::GlobalValue::InternalLinkage, cinit,
00312                                          llvm::Twine("static.") +
00313                                          llvm::Twine(sym->pos.first_line) + 
00314                                          llvm::Twine(".") + sym->name.c_str());
00315             // Tell the FunctionEmitContext about the variable 
00316             ctx->EmitVariableDebugInfo(sym);
00317         }
00318         else {
00319             // For non-static variables, allocate storage on the stack
00320             sym->storagePtr = ctx->AllocaInst(llvmType, sym->name.c_str());
00321             // Tell the FunctionEmitContext about the variable; must do
00322             // this before the initializer stuff.
00323             ctx->EmitVariableDebugInfo(sym);
00324             // And then get it initialized...
00325             lInitSymbol(sym->storagePtr, sym->name.c_str(), type, decl->initExpr,
00326                         ctx, sym->pos);
00327         }
00328     }
00329 }
00330 
00331 
00332 Stmt *
00333 DeclStmt::Optimize() {
00334     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < declaration->declarators.size(); ++i) {
00335         Declarator *decl = declaration->declarators[i];
00336         if (decl && decl->initExpr) {
00337             decl->initExpr = decl->initExpr->Optimize();
00338 
00339             // If the variable is const-qualified, after we've optimized
00340             // the initializer expression, see if we have a ConstExpr.  If
00341             // so, save it in Symbol::constValue where it can be used in
00342             // optimizing later expressions that have this symbol in them.
00343             // Note that there are cases where the expression may be
00344             // constant but where we don't have a ConstExpr; an example is
00345             // const arrays--the ConstExpr implementation just can't
00346             // represent an array of values.
00347             //
00348             // All this is fine in terms of the code that's generated in
00349             // the end (LLVM's constant folding stuff is good), but it
00350             // means that the ispc compiler's ability to reason about what
00351             // is definitely a compile-time constant for things like
00352             // computing array sizes from non-trivial expressions is
00353             // consequently limited.
00354             Symbol *sym = decl->sym;
00355             if (sym->type && sym->type->IsConstType() && decl->initExpr && 
00356                 dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(decl->initExpr) == NULL &&
00357                 Type::Equal(decl->initExpr->GetType(), sym->type))
00358                 sym->constValue = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(decl->initExpr);
00359         }
00360     }
00361     return this;
00362 }
00363 
00364 
00365 Stmt *
00366 DeclStmt::TypeCheck() {
00367     bool encounteredError = false;
00368     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < declaration->declarators.size(); ++i) {
00369         Declarator *decl = declaration->declarators[i];
00370         if (!decl) {
00371             encounteredError = true;
00372             continue;
00373         }
00374 
00375         if (!decl->initExpr)
00376             continue;
00377         decl->initExpr = decl->initExpr->TypeCheck();
00378         if (!decl->initExpr)
00379             continue;
00380 
00381         // get the right type for stuff like const float foo = 2; so that
00382         // the int->float type conversion is in there and we don't return
00383         // an int as the constValue later...
00384         const Type *type = decl->sym->type;
00385         if (dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type) != NULL ||
00386             dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL) {
00387             // If it's an expr list with an atomic type, we'll later issue
00388             // an error.  Need to leave decl->initExpr as is in that case so it
00389             // is in fact caught later, though.
00390             if (dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(decl->initExpr) == NULL)
00391                 decl->initExpr = decl->initExpr->TypeConv(type, "initializer");
00392         }
00393     }
00394     return encounteredError ? NULL : this;
00395 }

00398 void
00399 DeclStmt::Print(int indent) const {
00400     printf("%*cDecl Stmt:", indent, ' ');
00401     pos.Print();
00402     if (declaration) 
00403         declaration->Print();
00404     printf("\n");
00405 }

00407 
00408 int
00409 DeclStmt::EstimateCost() const {
00410     int cost = 0;
00411     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < declaration->declarators.size(); ++i)
00412         if (declaration->declarators[i]->initExpr)
00413             cost += declaration->declarators[i]->initExpr->EstimateCost();
00414     return cost;
00415 }

00418 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00419 // IfStmt
00420 
00421 IfStmt::IfStmt(Expr *t, Stmt *ts, Stmt *fs, bool checkCoherence, SourcePos p) 
00422     : Stmt(p), test(t), trueStmts(ts), falseStmts(fs), 
00423       doAllCheck(checkCoherence &&
00424                  !g->opt.disableCoherentControlFlow),
00425       doAnyCheck(test->GetType() != NULL &&
00426                  test->GetType()->IsVaryingType()) {
00427 }
00428 
00429 
00430 static void
00431 lEmitIfStatements(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, Stmt *stmts, const char *trueOrFalse) {
00432     if (!stmts)
00433         return;
00434 
00435     if (dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(stmts) == NULL)
00436         ctx->StartScope();
00437     ctx->AddInstrumentationPoint(trueOrFalse);
00438     stmts->EmitCode(ctx);
00439     if (dynamic_cast<const StmtList *>(stmts) == NULL)
00440         ctx->EndScope();
00441 }
00442 
00443 void
00444 IfStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
00445     // First check all of the things that might happen due to errors
00446     // earlier in compilation and bail out if needed so that we don't
00447     // dereference NULL pointers in the below...
00448     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
00449         return;
00450     if (!test) 
00451         return;
00452     const Type *testType = test->GetType();
00453     if (!testType)
00454         return;
00455 
00456     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
00457     bool isUniform = testType->IsUniformType();
00458 
00459     llvm::Value *testValue = test->GetValue(ctx);
00460     if (testValue == NULL)
00461         return;
00462 
00463     if (isUniform) {
00464         ctx->StartUniformIf(ctx->GetMask());
00465         if (doAllCheck)
00466             Warning(test->pos, "Uniform condition supplied to \"cif\" statement.");
00467 
00468         // 'If' statements with uniform conditions are relatively
00469         // straightforward.  We evaluate the condition and then jump to
00470         // either the 'then' or 'else' clause depending on its value.
00471         llvm::BasicBlock *bthen = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("if_then");
00472         llvm::BasicBlock *belse = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("if_else");
00473         llvm::BasicBlock *bexit = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("if_exit");
00474 
00475         // Jump to the appropriate basic block based on the value of
00476         // the 'if' test
00477         ctx->BranchInst(bthen, belse, testValue);
00478 
00479         // Emit code for the 'true' case
00480         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bthen);
00481         lEmitIfStatements(ctx, trueStmts, "true");
00482         if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
00483             ctx->BranchInst(bexit);
00484 
00485         // Emit code for the 'false' case
00486         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(belse);
00487         lEmitIfStatements(ctx, falseStmts, "false");
00488         if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock())
00489             ctx->BranchInst(bexit);
00490 
00491         // Set the active basic block to the newly-created exit block
00492         // so that subsequent emitted code starts there.
00493         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bexit);
00494         ctx->EndIf();
00495     }
00496     else
00497         emitVaryingIf(ctx, testValue);
00498 }
00499 
00500 
00501 Stmt *
00502 IfStmt::Optimize() {
00503     if (test) 
00504         test = test->Optimize();
00505     if (trueStmts) 
00506         trueStmts = trueStmts->Optimize();
00507     if (falseStmts) 
00508         falseStmts = falseStmts->Optimize();
00509     return this;
00510 }
00511 
00512 
00513 Stmt *IfStmt::TypeCheck() {
00514     if (test) {
00515         test = test->TypeCheck();
00516         if (test) {
00517             const Type *testType = test->GetType();
00518             if (testType) {
00519                 bool isUniform = testType->IsUniformType() && !g->opt.disableUniformControlFlow;
00520                 if (!testType->IsNumericType() && !testType->IsBoolType()) {
00521                     Error(test->pos, "Type \"%s\" can't be converted to boolean for \"if\" test.",
00522                           testType->GetString().c_str());
00523                     return NULL;
00524                 }
00525                 test = new TypeCastExpr(isUniform ? AtomicType::UniformBool : 
00526                                         AtomicType::VaryingBool, 
00527                                         test, test->pos);
00528                 assert(test);
00529             }
00530         }
00531     }
00532     if (trueStmts)
00533         trueStmts = trueStmts->TypeCheck();
00534     if (falseStmts) 
00535         falseStmts = falseStmts->TypeCheck();
00536 
00537     return this;
00538 }
00539 
00540 
00541 int
00542 IfStmt::EstimateCost() const {
00543     return ((test ? test->EstimateCost() : 0) +
00544             (trueStmts ? trueStmts->EstimateCost() : 0) +
00545             (falseStmts ? falseStmts->EstimateCost() : 0));
00546 }
00547 
00548 
00549 void
00550 IfStmt::Print(int indent) const {
00551     printf("%*cIf Stmt %s", indent, ' ', doAllCheck ? "DO ALL CHECK" : "");
00552     pos.Print();
00553     printf("\n%*cTest: ", indent+4, ' ');
00554     test->Print();
00555     printf("\n");
00556     if (trueStmts) {
00557         printf("%*cTrue:\n", indent+4, ' ');
00558         trueStmts->Print(indent+8);
00559     }
00560     if (falseStmts) {
00561         printf("%*cFalse:\n", indent+4, ' ');
00562         falseStmts->Print(indent+8);
00563     }
00564 }
00565 
00566 
00567 /** Emit code to run both the true and false statements for the if test,
00568     with the mask set appropriately before running each one. 
00569 */
00570 void
00571 IfStmt::emitMaskedTrueAndFalse(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *oldMask, 
00572                                llvm::Value *test) const {
00573     if (trueStmts) {
00574         ctx->MaskAnd(oldMask, test);
00575         lEmitIfStatements(ctx, trueStmts, "if: expr mixed, true statements");
00576         // under varying control flow,, returns can't stop instruction
00577         // emission, so this better be non-NULL...
00578         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()); 
00579     }
00580     if (falseStmts) {
00581         ctx->MaskAndNot(oldMask, test);
00582         lEmitIfStatements(ctx, falseStmts, "if: expr mixed, false statements");
00583         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
00584     }
00585 }
00586 
00587 
00588 /** Similar to the Stmt variant of this function, this conservatively
00589     checks to see if it's safe to run the code for the given Expr even if
00590     the mask is 'all off'.
00591  */
00592 static bool
00593 lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(Expr *expr) {
00594     if (expr == NULL)
00595         return false;
00596 
00597     UnaryExpr *ue;
00598     if ((ue = dynamic_cast<UnaryExpr *>(expr)) != NULL)
00599         return lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(ue->expr);
00600 
00601     BinaryExpr *be;
00602     if ((be = dynamic_cast<BinaryExpr *>(expr)) != NULL)
00603         return (lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(be->arg0) &&
00604                 lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(be->arg1));
00605 
00606     AssignExpr *ae;
00607     if ((ae = dynamic_cast<AssignExpr *>(expr)) != NULL)
00608         return (lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(ae->lvalue) &&
00609                 lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(ae->rvalue));
00610 
00611     SelectExpr *se;
00612     if ((se = dynamic_cast<SelectExpr *>(expr)) != NULL)
00613         return (lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(se->test) && 
00614                 lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(se->expr1) && 
00615                 lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(se->expr2));
00616 
00617     ExprList *el;
00618     if ((el = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(expr)) != NULL) {
00619         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < el->exprs.size(); ++i)
00620             if (!lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(el->exprs[i]))
00621                 return false;
00622         return true;
00623     }
00624 
00625     FunctionCallExpr *fce;
00626     if ((fce = dynamic_cast<FunctionCallExpr *>(expr)) != NULL)
00627         // FIXME: If we could somehow determine that the function being
00628         // called was safe (and all of the args Exprs were safe, then it'd
00629         // be nice to be able to return true here.  (Consider a call to
00630         // e.g. floatbits() in the stdlib.)  Unfortunately for now we just
00631         // have to be conservative.
00632         return false;
00633 
00634     IndexExpr *ie;
00635     if ((ie = dynamic_cast<IndexExpr *>(expr)) != NULL) {
00636         // If we can determine at compile time the size of the array/vector
00637         // and if the indices are compile-time constants, then we may be
00638         // able to safely run this under a predicated if statement..
00639         if (ie->arrayOrVector == NULL)
00640             return false;
00641 
00642         const Type *type = ie->arrayOrVector->GetType();
00643         ConstExpr *ce = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(ie->index);
00644         if (type == NULL || ce == NULL)
00645             return false;
00646         if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type) != NULL)
00647             type = type->GetReferenceTarget();
00648 
00649         const SequentialType *seqType = 
00650             dynamic_cast<const SequentialType *>(type);
00651         assert(seqType != NULL);
00652         int nElements = seqType->GetElementCount();
00653         if (nElements == 0)
00654             // Unsized array, so we can't be sure
00655             return false;
00656 
00657         int32_t indices[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
00658         int count = ce->AsInt32(indices);
00659         for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
00660             if (indices[i] < 0 || indices[i] >= nElements)
00661                 return false;
00662 
00663         // All indices are in-bounds
00664         return true;
00665     }
00666 
00667     MemberExpr *me;
00668     if ((me = dynamic_cast<MemberExpr *>(expr)) != NULL)
00669         return lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(me->expr);
00670 
00671     if (dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr) != NULL)
00672         return true;
00673 
00674     TypeCastExpr *tce;
00675     if ((tce = dynamic_cast<TypeCastExpr *>(expr)) != NULL)
00676         return lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(tce->expr);
00677 
00678     ReferenceExpr *re;
00679     if ((re = dynamic_cast<ReferenceExpr *>(expr)) != NULL)
00680         return lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(re->expr);
00681 
00682     DereferenceExpr *dre;
00683     if ((dre = dynamic_cast<DereferenceExpr *>(expr)) != NULL)
00684         return lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(dre->expr);
00685 
00686     if (dynamic_cast<SymbolExpr *>(expr) != NULL ||
00687         dynamic_cast<FunctionSymbolExpr *>(expr) != NULL ||
00688         dynamic_cast<SyncExpr *>(expr) != NULL)
00689         return true;
00690 
00691     FATAL("Unknown Expr type in lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff()");
00692     return false;
00693 }
00694 
00695 
00696 /** Given an arbitrary statement, this function conservatively tests to see
00697     if it's safe to run the code for the statement even if the mask is all
00698     off.  Here we just need to determine which kind of statement we have
00699     and recursively traverse it and/or the expressions inside of it.
00700  */
00701 static bool
00702 lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(Stmt *stmt) {
00703     if (stmt == NULL)
00704         return true;
00705 
00706     ExprStmt *es;
00707     if ((es = dynamic_cast<ExprStmt *>(stmt)) != NULL)
00708         return lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(es->expr);
00709 
00710     DeclStmt *ds;
00711     if ((ds = dynamic_cast<DeclStmt *>(stmt)) != NULL) {
00712         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < ds->declaration->declarators.size(); ++i)
00713             if (!lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(ds->declaration->declarators[i]->initExpr))
00714                 return false;
00715         return true;
00716     }
00717 
00718     IfStmt *is;
00719     if ((is = dynamic_cast<IfStmt *>(stmt)) != NULL)
00720         return (lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(is->test) &&
00721                 lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(is->trueStmts) &&
00722                 lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(is->falseStmts));
00723 
00724     DoStmt *dos;
00725     if ((dos = dynamic_cast<DoStmt *>(stmt)) != NULL)
00726         return (lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(dos->testExpr) &&
00727                 lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(dos->bodyStmts));
00728 
00729     ForStmt *fs;
00730     if ((fs = dynamic_cast<ForStmt *>(stmt)) != NULL)
00731         return (lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(fs->init) &&
00732                 lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(fs->test) &&
00733                 lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(fs->step) &&
00734                 lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(fs->stmts));
00735 
00736     if (dynamic_cast<BreakStmt *>(stmt) != NULL ||
00737         dynamic_cast<ContinueStmt *>(stmt) != NULL)
00738         return true;
00739 
00740     ReturnStmt *rs;
00741     if ((rs = dynamic_cast<ReturnStmt *>(stmt)) != NULL)
00742         return lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(rs->val);
00743 
00744     StmtList *sl;
00745     if ((sl = dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(stmt)) != NULL) {
00746         const std::vector<Stmt *> &sls = sl->GetStatements();
00747         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < sls.size(); ++i)
00748             if (!lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(sls[i]))
00749                 return false;
00750         return true;
00751     }
00752 
00753     PrintStmt *ps;
00754     if ((ps = dynamic_cast<PrintStmt *>(stmt)) != NULL)
00755         return lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(ps->values);
00756 
00757     FATAL("Unexpected stmt type in lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff()");
00758     return false;
00759 }
00760 
00761 
00762 /** Emit code for an if test that checks the mask and the test values and
00763     tries to be smart about jumping over code that doesn't need to be run.
00764  */
00765 void
00766 IfStmt::emitVaryingIf(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *ltest) const {
00767     llvm::Value *oldMask = ctx->GetMask();
00768     if (oldMask == LLVMMaskAllOn) {
00769         // We can tell that the mask is on statically at compile time; just
00770         // emit code for the 'if test with the mask all on' path
00771         llvm::BasicBlock *bDone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_done");
00772         emitMaskAllOn(ctx, ltest, bDone);
00773         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bDone);
00774     }
00775     else if (doAllCheck) {
00776         // We can't tell if the mask going into the if is all on at the
00777         // compile time.  Emit code to check for this and then either run
00778         // the code for the 'all on' or the 'mixed' case depending on the
00779         // mask's value at runtime.
00780         llvm::BasicBlock *bAllOn = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_mask_all");
00781         llvm::BasicBlock *bMixedOn = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_mask_mixed");
00782         llvm::BasicBlock *bDone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_done");
00783 
00784         // Jump to either bAllOn or bMixedOn, depending on the mask's value 
00785         llvm::Value *maskAllQ = ctx->All(oldMask);
00786         ctx->BranchInst(bAllOn, bMixedOn, maskAllQ);
00787 
00788         // Emit code for the 'mask all on' case
00789         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bAllOn);
00790         // We start by explicitly storing "all on" into the mask mask.
00791         // Note that this doesn't change its actual value, but doing so
00792         // lets the compiler see what's going on so that subsequent
00793         // optimizations for code emitted here can operate with the
00794         // knowledge that the mask is definitely all on (until it modifies
00795         // the mask itself).
00796         ctx->SetMask(LLVMMaskAllOn);
00797         emitMaskAllOn(ctx, ltest, bDone);
00798         
00799         // And emit code for the mixed mask case
00800         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bMixedOn);
00801         emitMaskMixed(ctx, oldMask, ltest, bDone);
00802 
00803         // When done, set the current basic block to the block that the two
00804         // paths above jump to when they're done.
00805         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bDone);
00806     }
00807     else if (trueStmts != NULL || falseStmts != NULL) {
00808         // If there is nothing that is potentially unsafe to run with all
00809         // lanes off in the true and false statements and if the total
00810         // complexity of those two is relatively simple, then we'll go
00811         // ahead and emit straightline code that runs both sides, updating
00812         // the mask accordingly.  This is useful for efficiently compiling
00813         // things like:
00814         //
00815         // if (foo) x = 0;
00816         // else     ++x;
00817         //
00818         // Where the overhead of checking if any of the program instances wants
00819         // to run one side or the other is more than the actual computation.
00820         // The lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff() checks to make sure that we don't do this
00821         // for potentially dangerous code like:
00822         //
00823         // if (index < count) array[index] = 0;
00824         //
00825         // where our use of blend for conditional assignments doesn't check
00826         // for the 'all lanes' off case.
00827         if (lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(trueStmts) &&
00828             lSafeToRunWithAllLanesOff(falseStmts) &&
00829             (((trueStmts ? trueStmts->EstimateCost() : 0) + 
00830               (falseStmts ? falseStmts->EstimateCost() : 0)) < 
00831              PREDICATE_SAFE_IF_STATEMENT_COST)) {
00832             ctx->StartVaryingIf(oldMask);
00833             emitMaskedTrueAndFalse(ctx, oldMask, ltest);
00834             assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
00835             ctx->EndIf();
00836         }
00837         else {
00838             assert(doAnyCheck);
00839             llvm::BasicBlock *bDone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("if_done");
00840             emitMaskMixed(ctx, oldMask, ltest, bDone);
00841             ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bDone);
00842         }
00843     }
00844 }
00845 
00846 
00847 /** Emits code for 'if' tests under the case where we know that the program
00848     mask is all on.
00849  */
00850 void
00851 IfStmt::emitMaskAllOn(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *ltest, 
00852                       llvm::BasicBlock *bDone) const {
00853     // First, check the value of the test.  If it's all on, then we jump to
00854     // a basic block that will only have code for the true case.
00855     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestAll = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_test_all");
00856     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestNoneCheck = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_test_none_check");
00857     llvm::Value *testAllQ = ctx->All(ltest);
00858     ctx->BranchInst(bTestAll, bTestNoneCheck, testAllQ);
00859 
00860     // Emit code for the 'test is all true' case
00861     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestAll);
00862     ctx->StartVaryingIf(LLVMMaskAllOn);
00863     lEmitIfStatements(ctx, trueStmts, "if: all on mask, expr all true");
00864     ctx->EndIf();
00865     if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock() != NULL)
00866         // bblock may legitimately be NULL since if there's a return stmt
00867         // or break or continue we can actually jump and end emission since
00868         // we know all of the lanes are following this path...
00869         ctx->BranchInst(bDone);
00870 
00871     // The test isn't all true.  Now emit code to determine if it's all
00872     // false, or has mixed values.
00873     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestNoneCheck);
00874     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestNone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_test_none");
00875     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestMixed = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_test_mixed");
00876     llvm::Value *testMixedQ = ctx->Any(ltest);
00877     ctx->BranchInst(bTestMixed, bTestNone, testMixedQ);
00878 
00879     // Emit code for the 'test is all false' case
00880     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestNone);
00881     ctx->StartVaryingIf(LLVMMaskAllOn);
00882     lEmitIfStatements(ctx, falseStmts, "if: all on mask, expr all false");
00883     ctx->EndIf();
00884     if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock())
00885         // bblock may be NULL since if there's a return stmt or break or
00886         // continue we can actually jump or whatever and end emission...
00887         ctx->BranchInst(bDone);
00888 
00889     // Finally emit code for the 'mixed true/false' case.  We unavoidably
00890     // need to run both the true and the false statements.
00891     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestMixed);
00892     ctx->StartVaryingIf(LLVMMaskAllOn);
00893     emitMaskedTrueAndFalse(ctx, LLVMMaskAllOn, ltest);
00894     // In this case, return/break/continue isn't allowed to jump and end
00895     // emission.
00896     assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
00897     ctx->EndIf();
00898     ctx->BranchInst(bDone);
00899 }
00900 
00901 
00902 /** Emit code for an 'if' test where the lane mask is known to be mixed
00903     on/off going into it.
00904  */
00905 void
00906 IfStmt::emitMaskMixed(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *oldMask, 
00907                       llvm::Value *ltest, llvm::BasicBlock *bDone) const {
00908     ctx->StartVaryingIf(oldMask);
00909     llvm::BasicBlock *bNext = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("safe_if_after_true");
00910     if (trueStmts != NULL) {
00911         llvm::BasicBlock *bRunTrue = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("safe_if_run_true");
00912         ctx->MaskAnd(oldMask, ltest);
00913 
00914         // Do any of the program instances want to run the 'true'
00915         // block?  If not, jump ahead to bNext.
00916         llvm::Value *maskAnyQ = ctx->Any(ctx->GetMask());
00917         ctx->BranchInst(bRunTrue, bNext, maskAnyQ);
00918 
00919         // Emit statements for true
00920         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bRunTrue);
00921         lEmitIfStatements(ctx, trueStmts, "if: expr mixed, true statements");
00922         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()); 
00923         ctx->BranchInst(bNext);
00924         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bNext);
00925     }
00926     if (falseStmts != NULL) {
00927         llvm::BasicBlock *bRunFalse = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("safe_if_run_false");
00928         bNext = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("safe_if_after_false");
00929         ctx->MaskAndNot(oldMask, ltest);
00930 
00931         // Similarly, check to see if any of the instances want to
00932         // run the 'false' block...
00933         llvm::Value *maskAnyQ = ctx->Any(ctx->GetMask());
00934         ctx->BranchInst(bRunFalse, bNext, maskAnyQ);
00935 
00936         // Emit code for false
00937         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bRunFalse);
00938         lEmitIfStatements(ctx, falseStmts, "if: expr mixed, false statements");
00939         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
00940         ctx->BranchInst(bNext);
00941         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bNext);
00942     }
00943     ctx->BranchInst(bDone);
00944     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bDone);
00945     ctx->EndIf();
00946 }
00947 
00948 
00949 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00950 // DoStmt
00951 
00952 /** Given a statment, walk through it to see if there is a 'break' or
00953     'continue' statement inside if its children, under varying control
00954     flow.  We need to detect this case for loops since what might otherwise
00955     look like a 'uniform' loop needs to have code emitted to do all of the
00956     lane management stuff if this is the case.
00957  */ 
00958 static bool
00959 lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(Stmt *stmt, bool inVaryingCF = false) {
00960     StmtList *sl;
00961     IfStmt *is;
00962 
00963     if ((sl = dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(stmt)) != NULL) {
00964         // Recurse through the children statements 
00965         const std::vector<Stmt *> &stmts = sl->GetStatements();
00966         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < stmts.size(); ++i)
00967             if (lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(stmts[i], inVaryingCF))
00968                 return true;
00969     }
00970     else if ((is = dynamic_cast<IfStmt *>(stmt)) != NULL) {
00971         // We've come to an 'if'.  Is the test type varying?  If so, then
00972         // we're under 'varying' control flow when we recurse through the
00973         // true and false statements.
00974         if (is->test != NULL) {
00975             const Type *type = is->test->GetType();
00976             if (type)
00977                 inVaryingCF |= type->IsVaryingType();
00978         }
00979 
00980         if (lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(is->trueStmts, inVaryingCF) ||
00981             lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(is->falseStmts, inVaryingCF))
00982             return true;
00983     }
00984     else if (dynamic_cast<BreakStmt *>(stmt) != NULL) {
00985         if (inVaryingCF)
00986             return true;
00987     }
00988     else if (dynamic_cast<ContinueStmt *>(stmt) != NULL) {
00989         if (inVaryingCF)
00990             return true;
00991     }
00992     // Important: note that we don't recurse into do/for loops here but
00993     // just return false.  For the question of whether a given loop needs
00994     // to do mask management stuff, breaks/continues inside nested loops
00995     // inside of them don't matter.
00996     return false;
00997 }
00998 
00999 
01000 DoStmt::DoStmt(Expr *t, Stmt *s, bool cc, SourcePos p) 
01001     : Stmt(p), testExpr(t), bodyStmts(s), 
01002       doCoherentCheck(cc && !g->opt.disableCoherentControlFlow) {
01003 }
01004 
01005 
01006 void DoStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
01007     // Check for things that could be NULL due to earlier errors during
01008     // compilation.
01009     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
01010         return;
01011     if (!testExpr || !testExpr->GetType()) 
01012         return;
01013 
01014     bool uniformTest = testExpr->GetType()->IsUniformType();
01015     if (uniformTest && doCoherentCheck)
01016         Warning(pos, "Uniform condition supplied to \"cdo\" statement.");
01017 
01018     llvm::BasicBlock *bloop = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("do_loop");
01019     llvm::BasicBlock *bexit = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("do_exit");
01020     llvm::BasicBlock *btest = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("do_test");
01021 
01022     ctx->StartLoop(bexit, btest, uniformTest, ctx->GetMask());
01023 
01024     // Start by jumping into the loop body
01025     ctx->BranchInst(bloop);
01026 
01027     // And now emit code for the loop body
01028     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bloop);
01029     ctx->SetLoopMask(ctx->GetMask());
01030     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01031     // FIXME: in the StmtList::EmitCode() method takes starts/stops a new
01032     // scope around the statements in the list.  So if the body is just a
01033     // single statement (and thus not a statement list), we need a new
01034     // scope, but we don't want two scopes in the StmtList case.
01035     if (!dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(bodyStmts))
01036         ctx->StartScope();
01037 
01038     ctx->AddInstrumentationPoint("do loop body");
01039     if (doCoherentCheck && !uniformTest) {
01040         // Check to see if the mask is all on
01041         llvm::BasicBlock *bAllOn = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("do_all_on");
01042         llvm::BasicBlock *bMixed = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("do_mixed");
01043         ctx->BranchIfMaskAll(bAllOn, bMixed);
01044 
01045         // If so, emit code for the 'mask all on' case.  In particular,
01046         // explicitly set the mask to 'all on' (see rationale in
01047         // IfStmt::emitCoherentTests()), and then emit the code for the
01048         // loop body.
01049         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bAllOn);
01050         ctx->SetMask(LLVMMaskAllOn);
01051         if (bodyStmts)
01052             bodyStmts->EmitCode(ctx);
01053         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
01054         ctx->BranchInst(btest);
01055 
01056         // The mask is mixed.  Just emit the code for the loop body.
01057         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bMixed);
01058         if (bodyStmts)
01059             bodyStmts->EmitCode(ctx);
01060         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
01061         ctx->BranchInst(btest);
01062     }
01063     else {
01064         // Otherwise just emit the code for the loop body.  The current
01065         // mask is good.
01066         if (bodyStmts)
01067             bodyStmts->EmitCode(ctx);
01068         if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock())
01069             ctx->BranchInst(btest);
01070     }
01071     // End the scope we started above, if needed.
01072     if (!dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(bodyStmts))
01073         ctx->EndScope();
01074 
01075     // Now emit code for the loop test.
01076     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(btest);
01077     // First, emit code to restore the mask value for any lanes that
01078     // executed a 'continue' during the current loop before we go and emit
01079     // the code for the test.  This is only necessary for varying loops;
01080     // 'uniform' loops just jump when they hit a continue statement and
01081     // don't mess with the mask.
01082     if (!uniformTest)
01083         ctx->RestoreContinuedLanes();
01084     llvm::Value *testValue = testExpr->GetValue(ctx);
01085     if (!testValue)
01086         return;
01087 
01088     if (uniformTest)
01089         // For the uniform case, just jump to the top of the loop or the
01090         // exit basic block depending on the value of the test.
01091         ctx->BranchInst(bloop, bexit, testValue);
01092     else {
01093         // For the varying case, update the mask based on the value of the
01094         // test.  If any program instances still want to be running, jump
01095         // to the top of the loop.  Otherwise, jump out.
01096         llvm::Value *mask = ctx->GetMask();
01097         ctx->MaskAnd(mask, testValue);
01098         ctx->BranchIfMaskAny(bloop, bexit);
01099     }
01100 
01101     // ...and we're done.  Set things up for subsequent code to be emitted
01102     // in the right basic block.
01103     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bexit);
01104     ctx->EndLoop();
01105 }
01106 
01107 
01108 Stmt *
01109 DoStmt::Optimize() {
01110     if (testExpr) 
01111         testExpr = testExpr->Optimize();
01112     if (bodyStmts) 
01113         bodyStmts = bodyStmts->Optimize();
01114     return this;
01115 }
01116 
01117 
01118 Stmt *
01119 DoStmt::TypeCheck() {
01120     if (testExpr) {
01121         testExpr = testExpr->TypeCheck();
01122         if (testExpr) {
01123             const Type *testType = testExpr->GetType();
01124             if (testType) {
01125                 if (!testType->IsNumericType() && !testType->IsBoolType()) {
01126                     Error(testExpr->pos, "Type \"%s\" can't be converted to boolean for \"while\" "
01127                           "test in \"do\" loop.", testExpr->GetType()->GetString().c_str());
01128                     return NULL;
01129                 }
01130 
01131                 // Should the test condition for the loop be uniform or
01132                 // varying?  It can be uniform only if three conditions are
01133                 // met.  First and foremost, the type of the test condition
01134                 // must be uniform.  Second, the user must not have set the
01135                 // dis-optimization option that disables uniform flow
01136                 // control.
01137                 //
01138                 // Thirdly, and most subtlely, there must not be any break
01139                 // or continue statements inside the loop that are within
01140                 // the scope of a 'varying' if statement.  If there are,
01141                 // then we type cast the test to be 'varying', so that the
01142                 // code generated for the loop includes masking stuff, so
01143                 // that we can track which lanes actually want to be
01144                 // running, accounting for breaks/continues.
01145                 bool uniformTest = (testType->IsUniformType() &&
01146                                     !g->opt.disableUniformControlFlow &&
01147                                     !lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(bodyStmts));
01148                 testExpr = new TypeCastExpr(uniformTest ? AtomicType::UniformBool :
01149                                                           AtomicType::VaryingBool,
01150                                             testExpr, testExpr->pos);
01151             }
01152         }
01153     }
01154 
01155     if (bodyStmts) 
01156         bodyStmts = bodyStmts->TypeCheck();
01157     return this;
01158 }
01159 
01160 
01161 int
01162 DoStmt::EstimateCost() const {
01163     return ((testExpr ? testExpr->EstimateCost() : 0) +
01164             (bodyStmts ? bodyStmts->EstimateCost() : 0));
01165 }
01166 
01167 
01168 void
01169 DoStmt::Print(int indent) const {
01170     printf("%*cDo Stmt", indent, ' ');
01171     pos.Print();
01172     printf(":\n");
01173     printf("%*cTest: ", indent+4, ' ');
01174     if (testExpr) testExpr->Print();
01175     printf("\n");
01176     if (bodyStmts) {
01177         printf("%*cStmts:\n", indent+4, ' ');
01178         bodyStmts->Print(indent+8);
01179     }
01180 }
01181 
01182 
01183 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01184 // ForStmt
01185 
01186 ForStmt::ForStmt(Stmt *i, Expr *t, Stmt *s, Stmt *st, bool cc, SourcePos p) 
01187     : Stmt(p), init(i), test(t), step(s), stmts(st), 
01188       doCoherentCheck(cc && !g->opt.disableCoherentControlFlow) {
01189 }
01190 
01191 
01192 void
01193 ForStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
01194     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
01195         return;
01196 
01197     llvm::BasicBlock *btest = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_test");
01198     llvm::BasicBlock *bstep = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_step");
01199     llvm::BasicBlock *bloop = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_loop");
01200     llvm::BasicBlock *bexit = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_exit");
01201 
01202     bool uniformTest = test ? test->GetType()->IsUniformType() :
01203         (!g->opt.disableUniformControlFlow &&
01204          !lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(stmts));
01205 
01206     ctx->StartLoop(bexit, bstep, uniformTest, ctx->GetMask());
01207     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01208 
01209     // If we have an initiailizer statement, start by emitting the code for
01210     // it and then jump into the loop test code.  (Also start a new scope
01211     // since the initiailizer may be a declaration statement).
01212     if (init) {
01213         assert(dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(init) == NULL);
01214         ctx->StartScope();
01215         init->EmitCode(ctx);
01216     }
01217     ctx->BranchInst(btest);
01218 
01219     assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
01220 #if 0
01221     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) {
01222         // when does this happen??
01223         if (init)
01224             ctx->EndScope();
01225         ctx->EndLoop();
01226         return;
01227     }
01228 #endif
01229 
01230     // Emit code to get the value of the loop test.  If no test expression
01231     // was provided, just go with a true value.
01232     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(btest);
01233     llvm::Value *ltest = NULL;
01234     if (test) {
01235         ltest = test->GetValue(ctx);
01236         if (!ltest) {
01237             ctx->EndScope();
01238             ctx->EndLoop();
01239             return;
01240         }
01241     }
01242     else
01243         ltest = uniformTest ? LLVMTrue : LLVMBoolVector(true);
01244 
01245     // Now use the test's value.  For a uniform loop, we can either jump to
01246     // the loop body or the loop exit, based on whether it's true or false.
01247     // For a non-uniform loop, we update the mask and jump into the loop if
01248     // any of the mask values are true.
01249     if (uniformTest) {
01250         if (doCoherentCheck)
01251             Warning(pos, "Uniform condition supplied to cfor/cwhile statement.");
01252         assert(ltest->getType() == LLVMTypes::BoolType);
01253         ctx->BranchInst(bloop, bexit, ltest);
01254     }
01255     else {
01256         llvm::Value *mask = ctx->GetMask();
01257         ctx->MaskAnd(mask, ltest);
01258         ctx->BranchIfMaskAny(bloop, bexit);
01259     }
01260 
01261     // On to emitting the code for the loop body.
01262     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bloop);
01263     ctx->SetLoopMask(ctx->GetMask());
01264     ctx->AddInstrumentationPoint("for loop body");
01265     if (!dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(stmts))
01266         ctx->StartScope();
01267 
01268     if (doCoherentCheck && !uniformTest) {
01269         // For 'varying' loops with the coherence check, we start by
01270         // checking to see if the mask is all on, after it has been updated
01271         // based on the value of the test.
01272         llvm::BasicBlock *bAllOn = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_all_on");
01273         llvm::BasicBlock *bMixed = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_mixed");
01274         ctx->BranchIfMaskAll(bAllOn, bMixed);
01275 
01276         // Emit code for the mask being all on.  Explicitly set the mask to
01277         // be on so that the optimizer can see that it's on (i.e. now that
01278         // the runtime test has passed, make this fact clear for code
01279         // generation at compile time here.)
01280         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bAllOn);
01281         ctx->SetMask(LLVMMaskAllOn);
01282         if (stmts)
01283             stmts->EmitCode(ctx);
01284         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
01285         ctx->BranchInst(bstep);
01286 
01287         // Emit code for the mask being mixed.  We should never run the
01288         // loop with the mask all off, based on the BranchIfMaskAny call
01289         // above.
01290         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bMixed);
01291         if (stmts)
01292             stmts->EmitCode(ctx);
01293         ctx->BranchInst(bstep);
01294     }
01295     else {
01296         // For both uniform loops and varying loops without the coherence
01297         // check, we know that at least one program instance wants to be
01298         // running the loop, so just emit code for the loop body and jump
01299         // to the loop step code.
01300         if (stmts)
01301             stmts->EmitCode(ctx);
01302         if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock())
01303             ctx->BranchInst(bstep);
01304     }
01305     if (!dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(stmts))
01306         ctx->EndScope();
01307 
01308     // Emit code for the loop step.  First, restore the lane mask of any
01309     // program instances that executed a 'continue' during the previous
01310     // iteration.  Then emit code for the loop step and then jump to the
01311     // test code.
01312     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bstep);
01313     ctx->RestoreContinuedLanes();
01314     if (step)
01315         step->EmitCode(ctx);
01316     ctx->BranchInst(btest);
01317 
01318     // Set the current emission basic block to the loop exit basic block
01319     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bexit);
01320     if (init)
01321         ctx->EndScope();
01322     ctx->EndLoop();
01323 }
01324 
01325 
01326 Stmt *
01327 ForStmt::Optimize() {
01328     if (test) 
01329         test = test->Optimize();
01330     if (init) 
01331         init = init->Optimize();
01332     if (step) 
01333         step = step->Optimize();
01334     if (stmts) 
01335         stmts = stmts->Optimize();
01336     return this;
01337 }
01338 
01339 
01340 Stmt *
01341 ForStmt::TypeCheck() {
01342     if (test) {
01343         test = test->TypeCheck();
01344         if (test) {
01345             const Type *testType = test->GetType();
01346             if (testType) {
01347                 if (!testType->IsNumericType() && !testType->IsBoolType()) {
01348                     Error(test->pos, "Type \"%s\" can't be converted to boolean for for loop test.",
01349                           test->GetType()->GetString().c_str());
01350                     return NULL;
01351                 }
01352 
01353                 // See comments in DoStmt::TypeCheck() regarding
01354                 // 'uniformTest' and the type cast here.
01355                 bool uniformTest = (testType->IsUniformType() &&
01356                                     !g->opt.disableUniformControlFlow &&
01357                                     !lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(stmts));
01358                 test = new TypeCastExpr(uniformTest ? AtomicType::UniformBool :
01359                                                       AtomicType::VaryingBool,
01360                                         test, test->pos);
01361             }
01362         }
01363     }
01364 
01365     if (init) 
01366         init = init->TypeCheck();
01367     if (step) 
01368         step = step->TypeCheck();
01369     if (stmts) 
01370         stmts = stmts->TypeCheck();
01371     return this;
01372 }
01373 
01374 
01375 int
01376 ForStmt::EstimateCost() const {
01377     bool uniformTest = test ? test->GetType()->IsUniformType() :
01378         (!g->opt.disableUniformControlFlow &&
01379          !lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(stmts));
01380 
01381     return ((init ? init->EstimateCost() : 0) +
01382             (test ? test->EstimateCost() : 0) +
01383             (step ? step->EstimateCost() : 0) +
01384             (stmts ? stmts->EstimateCost() : 0) +
01385             (uniformTest ? COST_UNIFORM_LOOP : COST_VARYING_LOOP));
01386 }
01387 
01388 
01389 void
01390 ForStmt::Print(int indent) const {
01391     printf("%*cFor Stmt", indent, ' ');
01392     pos.Print();
01393     printf("\n");
01394     if (init) {
01395         printf("%*cInit:\n", indent+4, ' ');
01396         init->Print(indent+8);
01397     }
01398     if (test) {
01399         printf("%*cTest: ", indent+4, ' ');
01400         test->Print();
01401         printf("\n");
01402     }
01403     if (step) {
01404         printf("%*cStep:\n", indent+4, ' ');
01405         step->Print(indent+8);
01406     }
01407     if (stmts) {
01408         printf("%*cStmts:\n", indent+4, ' ');
01409         stmts->Print(indent+8);
01410     }
01411 }

01560 void
01561 StmtList::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
01562     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
01563         return;
01564 
01565     ctx->StartScope();
01566     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01567     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < stmts.size(); ++i)
01568         if (stmts[i])
01569             stmts[i]->EmitCode(ctx);
01570     ctx->EndScope();
01571 }

01577         if (stmts[i])
01578             stmts[i] = stmts[i]->Optimize();
01579     return this;
01580 }

01587             stmts[i] = stmts[i]->TypeCheck();

01592 int
01593 StmtList::EstimateCost() const {
01594     int cost = 0;
01595     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < stmts.size(); ++i)
01596         if (stmts[i])
01597             cost += stmts[i]->EstimateCost();
01598     return cost;
01599 }

01613 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01614 // PrintStmt
01615 
01616 PrintStmt::PrintStmt(const std::string &f, Expr *v, SourcePos p) 
01617     : Stmt(p), format(f), values(v) {
01618 }
01619 
01620 /* Because the pointers to values that are passed to __do_print() are all
01621    void *s (and because ispc print() formatting strings statements don't
01622    encode types), we pass along a string to __do_print() where the i'th
01623    character encodes the type of the i'th value to be printed.  Needless to
01624    say, the encoding chosen here and the decoding code in __do_print() need
01625    to agree on the below!
01626  */
01627 static char
01628 lEncodeType(const Type *t) {
01629     if (t == AtomicType::UniformBool)   return 'b';
01630     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingBool)   return 'B';
01631     if (t == AtomicType::UniformInt32)  return 'i';
01632     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingInt32)  return 'I';
01633     if (t == AtomicType::UniformUInt32) return 'u';
01634     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingUInt32) return 'U';
01635     if (t == AtomicType::UniformFloat)  return 'f';
01636     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingFloat)  return 'F';
01637     if (t == AtomicType::UniformInt64)  return 'l';
01638     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingInt64)  return 'L';
01639     if (t == AtomicType::UniformUInt64) return 'v';
01640     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingUInt64) return 'V';
01641     if (t == AtomicType::UniformDouble) return 'd';
01642     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingDouble) return 'D';
01643     else return '\0';
01644 }
01645 
01646 
01647 /** Given an Expr for a value to be printed, emit the code to evaluate the
01648     expression and store the result to alloca'd memory.  Update the
01649     argTypes string with the type encoding for this expression.
01650  */
01651 static llvm::Value *
01652 lProcessPrintArg(Expr *expr, FunctionEmitContext *ctx, std::string &argTypes) {
01653     const Type *type = expr->GetType();
01654     if (type == NULL)
01655         return NULL;
01656 
01657     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type) != NULL) {
01658         expr = new DereferenceExpr(expr, expr->pos);
01659         type = expr->GetType();
01660         if (type == NULL)
01661             return NULL;
01662     }
01663 
01664     // Just int8 and int16 types to int32s...
01665     const Type *baseType = type->GetAsNonConstType()->GetAsUniformType();
01666     if (baseType == AtomicType::UniformInt8 ||
01667         baseType == AtomicType::UniformUInt8 ||
01668         baseType == AtomicType::UniformInt16 ||
01669         baseType == AtomicType::UniformUInt16) {
01670         expr = new TypeCastExpr(type->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformInt32 :
01671                                                         AtomicType::VaryingInt32, 
01672                                 expr, expr->pos);
01673         type = expr->GetType();
01674     }
01675         
01676     char t = lEncodeType(type->GetAsNonConstType());
01677     if (t == '\0') {
01678         Error(expr->pos, "Only atomic types are allowed in print statements; "
01679               "type \"%s\" is illegal.", type->GetString().c_str());
01680         return NULL;
01681     }
01682     else {
01683         argTypes.push_back(t);
01684 
01685         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *llvmExprType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
01686         llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(llvmExprType, "print_arg");
01687         llvm::Value *val = expr->GetValue(ctx);
01688         if (!val)
01689             return NULL;
01690         ctx->StoreInst(val, ptr);
01691 
01692         ptr = ctx->BitCastInst(ptr, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
01693         return ptr;
01694     }
01695 }
01696 
01697 
01698 /* PrintStmt works closely with the __do_print() function implemented in
01699    the builtins-c.c file.  In particular, the EmitCode() method here needs to
01700    take the arguments passed to it from ispc and generate a valid call to
01701    __do_print() with the information that __do_print() then needs to do the
01702    actual printing work at runtime.
01703  */
01704 void
01705 PrintStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
01706     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01707 
01708     // __do_print takes 5 arguments; we'll get them stored in the args[] array
01709     // in the code emitted below
01710     //
01711     // 1. the format string
01712     // 2. a string encoding the types of the values being printed, 
01713     //    one character per value
01714     // 3. the number of running program instances (i.e. the target's
01715     //    vector width)
01716     // 4. the current lane mask
01717     // 5. a pointer to an array of pointers to the values to be printed
01718     llvm::Value *args[5];
01719     std::string argTypes;
01720 
01721     if (values == NULL) {
01722         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ptrPtrType = 
01723             llvm::PointerType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType, 0);
01724         args[4] = llvm::Constant::getNullValue(ptrPtrType);
01725     }
01726     else {
01727         // Get the values passed to the print() statement evaluated and
01728         // stored in memory so that we set up the array of pointers to them
01729         // for the 5th __do_print() argument
01730         ExprList *elist = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(values);
01731         int nArgs = elist ? elist->exprs.size() : 1;
01732 
01733         // Allocate space for the array of pointers to values to be printed 
01734         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *argPtrArrayType = 
01735             llvm::ArrayType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType, nArgs);
01736         llvm::Value *argPtrArray = ctx->AllocaInst(argPtrArrayType,
01737                                                    "print_arg_ptrs");
01738         // Store the array pointer as a void **, which is what __do_print()
01739         // expects
01740         args[4] = ctx->BitCastInst(argPtrArray, 
01741                                    llvm::PointerType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType, 0));
01742 
01743         // Now, for each of the arguments, emit code to evaluate its value
01744         // and store the value into alloca'd storage.  Then store the
01745         // pointer to the alloca'd storage into argPtrArray.
01746         if (elist) {
01747             for (unsigned int i = 0; i < elist->exprs.size(); ++i) {
01748                 Expr *expr = elist->exprs[i];
01749                 if (!expr)
01750                     return;
01751                 llvm::Value *ptr = lProcessPrintArg(expr, ctx, argTypes);
01752                 if (!ptr)
01753                     return;
01754 
01755                 llvm::Value *arrayPtr = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(argPtrArray, 0, i);
01756                 ctx->StoreInst(ptr, arrayPtr);
01757             }
01758         }
01759         else {
01760             llvm::Value *ptr = lProcessPrintArg(values, ctx, argTypes);
01761             if (!ptr)
01762                 return;
01763             llvm::Value *arrayPtr = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(argPtrArray, 0, 0);
01764             ctx->StoreInst(ptr, arrayPtr);
01765         }
01766     }
01767 
01768     // Now we can emit code to call __do_print()
01769     llvm::Function *printFunc = m->module->getFunction("__do_print");
01770     assert(printFunc);
01771 
01772     // Set up the rest of the parameters to it
01773     args[0] = ctx->GetStringPtr(format);
01774     args[1] = ctx->GetStringPtr(argTypes);
01775     args[2] = LLVMInt32(g->target.vectorWidth);
01776     args[3] = ctx->LaneMask(ctx->GetMask());
01777     std::vector<llvm::Value *> argVec(&args[0], &args[5]);
01778     ctx->CallInst(printFunc, argVec, "");
01779 }
01780 
01781 
01782 void
01783 PrintStmt::Print(int indent) const {
01784     printf("%*cPrint Stmt (%s)", indent, ' ', format.c_str());
01785 }
01786

01789 PrintStmt::Optimize() {
01790     if (values) 
01791         values = values->Optimize();
01792     return this;
01793 }

01796 Stmt *
01797 PrintStmt::TypeCheck() {
01798     if (values) 
01799         values = values->TypeCheck();
01800     return this;
01801 }
01802 
01803 
01804 int
01805 PrintStmt::EstimateCost() const {
01806     return COST_FUNCALL + (values ? values->EstimateCost() : 0);
01807 }
